text: It's not possible to get custom meta data tags once written.
creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com

text:
Created attachment 16405
Patch for src/java/org/apache/lenya/cms/metadata/MetaDataImpl.java

Improve handling for non-fixed elements.
creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com

text:
There is another bug when retrieving non fixed meta data:

loadElementValues(maps[type], elements[i].getTagName(),
    helper.getChildren(metaElement, elements[i].getTagName()));

should be

loadElementValues(maps[type], elements[i].getTagName(),
    helper.getChildren(metaElement, elements[i].getLocalName()));

I will update the patch.
creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com

text:
Created attachment 16410
Patch for src/java/org/apache/lenya/cms/metadata/MetaDataImpl.java

Updated patch because of another bug.
creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com

text:
I am currently reviewing your patch and would actually like to commit it, but I
don't fully understand it and how to test it.

Can you explain a bit more?

Thanks

Michi
creator: michi@apache.org
felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
text:
There has been two issues with the meta data implementation:

1. Meta data may either be from a fixed list or freely chosen.
   E.g. DublinCore meta data are from a fixed list, whereas
   custom meta data may be freely chosen. The support for
   non-fixed meta data was buggy, so that the CustomMetaData
   implementation did not work.

2. There was an issue with loading non-fixed meta data:
   The implementation selects the children of a specified
   meta data type (lenya, dublin core, custom). The
   selection code expected the local name of a child but
   was given the name with namespace, so it did not work.

Please let me know if you need further clarification ...
